title: 1  ! ipython suppress id=b0641b6ae09942babe0c88f69c55482d
2  Quarto Basics 2
text:
For a demonstration of a line plot on a polar axis, see Figure 2.1.





Figure 2.1: A line plot on a polar axis

title: 3  Introduction
text:
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.
#| label: fig-polar #| fig-cap: “A line plot on a polar axis”
import numpy as np import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01) theta = 4 * np.pi * r fig, ax = plt.subplots( subplot_kw = {‘projection’: ‘polar’} ) ax.plot(theta, r) ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2]) ax.grid(True) plt.show()




Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 4  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.
